instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after water damage
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with water damage. Have already repaired all main rails and now machine starts but still no image. I dont have for now usb-c to hdmi so can check if external display is working. 


Checked EDP area and <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing and than <SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PANEL_P3V3_EN</SIGNAL> are 0 too. All tests are done with good  lcd conected. 


I see that <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is coming from CPU. 


Any suggestion ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after water damage
threads.message:
Was the liquid spill clos to backlight pin of J8500?
In such case, CPU video output is dead...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after water damage
threads.message:
No, Not that area. FPC was perfect. 

P.S. if cpu video output is dead also will be same for external monitor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after water damage
threads.message: Just now it gives me about <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>  give me 6V  <SIGNAL>PANEL_P5V_EN</SIGNAL>  5V but display was still black with no backlight. My last boards are all with this kind of shitty  intermittent issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after water damage
threads.message:
Possibly crap under BGA chips.
Use good flux and heat them.
Worst thing if some data lines have got overvoltage from 5V, 13V, or even backlight output...
Liquid spill on the new boards (where Apple didn't start to solder chips one on top of other yet) is a nightmare.
